title: 110_hr392
content: The Act is titled the "District of Columbia and United States Territories Circulating Quarter Dollar Program Act" and it involves the issuance of redesigned quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and each of the territories. Section 5112 of title 31, United States Code, is amended to include a new subsection for the redesign and issuance of circulating quarter dollars honoring the District of Columbia and the territories in 2009. The coins will have designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and the territories, with flexibility in the placement of inscriptions. The redesign and issuance of circulating quarter dollars in 2009 will honor the District of Columbia and the territories with designs emblematic of them. The Secretary has flexibility in placing inscriptions on the coins. The redesign of circulating quarter dollars in 2009 will feature designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and various territories. The Secretary has the authority to select designs after consulting with relevant parties. The redesign of circulating quarter dollars in 2009 will feature designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and various territories. Each design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant officials and the Commission of Fine Arts. The redesign of circulating quarter dollars in 2009 will feature designs emblematic of the District of Columbia and territories. Designs will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant officials, the Commission of Fine Arts, and the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. Designs may be submitted through a selection and approval process developed by the Secretary, with participation from District or territorial officials, artists, engravers, and Mint members. The Secretary may include participation by District or territorial officials, artists, engravers, and the general public in selecting dignified designs for quarter dollars minted under this subsection. No frivolous or inappropriate designs are allowed, and certain representations like head and shoulders portraits are prohibited. The Secretary must ensure that only dignified designs are selected for quarter dollars minted under this subsection, with prohibitions on frivolous or inappropriate designs and certain representations like head and shoulders portraits. All coins minted under this subsection are considered numismatic items and may be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities. The Secretary may mint and issue quarter dollars in uncirculated and proof qualities, with the option to mint silver coins with a 90 percent silver content. Coins honoring the District of Columbia and territories will be issued in equal timing and order. The Secretary may mint quarter dollars with 90 percent silver content to honor the District of Columbia and territories in a specific order during 2009. If the District of Columbia or any territory becomes a state before the 10-year period ends, certain provisions will apply. If the District of Columbia or any territory becomes a state before the 10-year period ends, specific provisions will apply. If a territory becomes independent or ceases to be a territory before quarter dollars are minted, this subsection will no longer apply to that territory. Before quarter dollars bearing designs emblematic of a territory are minted, this subsection will no longer apply if the territory becomes a state or independent. The term 'territory' includes Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, the US Virgin Islands, and the Northern Mariana Islands. The House of Representatives passed the bill on January 23, 2007. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
